signature: public static void main(final String[] args)
name: main
javadoc:
/**
 * The main entry point of this application.
 *
 * This method prints out various platform-specific information to the console,
 * including the version, runtime, VM, OS, hardware, and locale.
 *
 * @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this implementation)
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * The main entry point of this application.
 *
 * This method prints out various platform-specific information to the console,
 * including the version, runtime, VM, OS, hardware, and locale.
 *
 * @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this implementation)
 * @return Nothing (void), as this is a static main method
 */

name: getHardware
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string describing the hardware configuration of the system.
 *
 * @return A string containing information about the number of processors, architecture,
 *         and instruction sets available on the system.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves detailed information about the system's hardware configuration.
 *
 * @return A formatted string describing the system's processor count, architecture, 
 *         and supported instruction set(s).
 */

name: getLocale
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string describing the default locale and platform encoding.
 *
 * @return A string containing the default locale and platform encoding.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves a string that describes the default locale and platform encoding,
 * providing information about the current system's settings for internationalization.
 *
 * @return A string containing the default locale and platform encoding, 
 *         formatted in a human-readable manner to facilitate understanding of the system's configuration.
 */

name: getOperatingSystem
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string describing the operating system and its version.
 *
 * @return a string in the format "operating_system version, architecture: architecture"
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string describing the operating system and its version,
 * including the underlying architecture.
 *
 * @return a string in the format "operating_system version, architecture: architecture"
 */

name: getRuntime
javadoc: /** * Returns a string describing the runtime environment. * * This method returns a string in the format: * runtime-name (build version) from vendor * * @return a string describing the runtime environment */
improved_javadoc: /** * Returns a string describing the runtime environment, including its name, build version, and vendor. * * The returned string is in the format: runtime-name (build-version) from vendor * * @return a string containing the runtime environment's details */

signature: private String getSystemProperty(final String prefix, final String name)
name: getSystemProperty
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a system property with the specified prefix and name.
 *
 * If the system property is not set, an empty string is returned.
 *
 * @param prefix The prefix to be prepended to the system property value
 * @param name   The name of the system property
 * @return      A string containing the prefixed system property value, or an empty string if the property is not set
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves the value of a system property with the specified prefix and name.
 *
 * If the system property does not exist, this method returns an empty string.
 *
 * @param prefix The prefix to be prepended to the system property value
 * @param name   The name of the system property (e.g. "java.home")
 * @return      A string containing the prefixed system property value, or an empty string if the property is not set
 */

name: getVirtualMachine
javadoc: /** * Returns a string describing the virtual machine. * * This method returns a string in the format: * VM Name (build VM Version, VM Info) * * @return A string describing the virtual machine */
improved_javadoc: /** * Returns a string describing the virtual machine, including its name, build version, and additional information. * * The returned string is in the format: VM Name (build VM Version, VM Info) * * @return A string containing detailed information about the virtual machine */

name: lookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Looks up a system property by its key.
 *
 * @param key the key of the system property to look up
 * @return the value of the system property, or null if the key is null
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the key does not match any known system property
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves the value associated with the specified system property.
 *
 * @param key the name of the system property to look up (cannot be null)
 * @return the value of the system property, or null if the key is not defined in the system properties
 * @throws NullPointerException if the key is null
 */
